intro: Pedicularis cabulica, commonly known as the Kashmir beauty or the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic nature, relying on host plants for nutrients. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to yellow, often resembling small, delicate butterflies. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, Pedicularis cabulica is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
